appeng.api.parts

Interface IPartHost

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ICustomCableConnection

    public interface IPartHost
extends ICustomCableConnection
    Implemented on AE's TileEntity. Do Not Implement

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      try to add a new part to the specified side, returns false if it failed to be added.
      boolean canAddPart(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack part, AEPartLocation side)
      Test if you can add a part to the specified side of the Part Host, AEPartLocation.UNKNOWN is used to represent the cable in the middle.
      void cleanup()
      remove host from world...
      void clearContainer()
      destroys the part container, for internal use.

      IPart getPart(AEPartLocation side)
      Get part by side ( center is AEPartLocation.UNKNOWN )
      IPart getPart(net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing side)
      Get part by side, this method cannot aquire the center part, you must use the other varient of getPart.
      net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity getTile() 
      boolean hasRedstone(AEPartLocation side)
      get the redstone state of host on this side, this value is cached internally.
      boolean isBlocked(net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing side)
      Used to test for FMP microblock blocking internally.
      boolean isEmpty()
      returns false if this block contains any parts or facades, true other wise.
      boolean isInWorld()
      true if the tile is in the world, other wise false.
      void markForSave()
      can be used by parts to trigger the tile or part to save.

      void partChanged()

      void removePart(AEPartLocation side, boolean suppressUpdate)
      removes the part on the side, this doesn't drop it or anything, if you don't do something with it, its just "gone" and its never coming back; think about it.
      SelectedPart selectPart(net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d pos)
      finds the part located at the position ( pos must be relative, not global )

    • Method Detail

      • getFacadeContainer

        IFacadeContainer getFacadeContainer()
        Returns:
        the facade container

      • canAddPart

        boolean canAddPart(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack part,
                   AEPartLocation side)
        Test if you can add a part to the specified side of the Part Host, AEPartLocation.UNKNOWN is used to represent the cable in the middle.
        Parameters:
        part - to be added part
        side - part placed onto side
        Returns:
        returns false if the part cannot be added.

      • addPart

        AEPartLocation addPart(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack is,
                       AEPartLocation side,
                       net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer owner,
                       net.minecraft.util.EnumHand hand)
        try to add a new part to the specified side, returns false if it failed to be added.
        Parameters:
        is - new part
        side - onto side
        owner - with owning player
        Returns:
        null if the item failed to add, the side it was placed on other wise ( may different for cables, AEPartLocation.UNKNOWN )

      • getPart

        IPart getPart(AEPartLocation side)
        Get part by side ( center is AEPartLocation.UNKNOWN )
        Parameters:
        side - side of part
        Returns:
        the part located on the specified side, or null if there is no part.

      • getPart

        IPart getPart(net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing side)
        Get part by side, this method cannot aquire the center part, you must use the other varient of getPart.
        Parameters:
        side - side of part
        Returns:
        the part located on the specified side, or null if there is no part.

      • removePart

        void removePart(AEPartLocation side,
                boolean suppressUpdate)
        removes the part on the side, this doesn't drop it or anything, if you don't do something with it, its just "gone" and its never coming back; think about it. if you want to drop the part you must request it prior to removing it.
        Parameters:
        side - side of part
        suppressUpdate - - used if you need to replace a part's INSTANCE, without really removing it first.

      • markForUpdate

        void markForUpdate()
        something changed, might want to send a packet to clients to update state.

      • getLocation

        DimensionalCoord getLocation()
        Returns:
        the physical location of the part host in the universe.

      • getTile

        net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity getTile()
        Returns:
        the tile entity for the host, this can either be an FMP tile, or a AE tile

      • getColor

        AEColor getColor()
        Returns:
        the color of the host type ( this is determined by the middle cable. ) if no cable is present, it returns AEColor .Transparent other wise it returns the color of the cable in the center.

      • clearContainer

        void clearContainer()
        destroys the part container, for internal use.

      • isBlocked

        boolean isBlocked(net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing side)
        Used to test for FMP microblock blocking internally.
        Returns:
        returns if microblocks are blocking this cable path.

      • selectPart

        SelectedPart selectPart(net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d pos)
        finds the part located at the position ( pos must be relative, not global )
        Parameters:
        pos - part position
        Returns:
        a new SelectedPart, this is never null.

      • markForSave

        void markForSave()
        can be used by parts to trigger the tile or part to save.

      • partChanged

        void partChanged()
        part of the LayerBase

      • hasRedstone

        boolean hasRedstone(AEPartLocation side)
        get the redstone state of host on this side, this value is cached internally.
        Parameters:
        side - side of part
        Returns:
        true of the part host is receiving redstone from an external source.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        returns false if this block contains any parts or facades, true other wise.

      • getLayerFlags

        java.util.Set<LayerFlags> getLayerFlags()
        Returns:
        a mutable list of flags you can adjust to track state.

      • cleanup

        void cleanup()
        remove host from world...

      • notifyNeighbors

        void notifyNeighbors()
        notify neighbors uf updated status.

      • isInWorld

        boolean isInWorld()
        true if the tile is in the world, other wise false.
        Returns:
        true if tile is in world
